episodes.title: Ep 11 Unlearning Purity - Men, Emotions, and Real Relationships with Steve and Bill
episodes.description:
Steve VanDermyden and Bill Schueler joined me for a conversation about their experiences in purity culture in the 2x2 church and the work they are doing after leaving.  They share openly and vulnerably about the impact of their upbringing on their emotional health and how they show up in relationships.  Steve also brings insights from his professional work as a relationship coach.  We talk about the lack of healthy emotional and relational role models, how to navigate conflict, communication in realtionships, sex positivity and the challenge of maintaining individuality in relationships where we were taught to be codependent.  

Notes and Resources : https://docs.google.com/document/d/105Q5aUOsU6-DT8IO9Cvyka5xtq8sCFP6sBMztCmmjKo/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: Founding CCF: Shane Garner and Devon Wijesinghe
Personal Story with Safe Church Task Force
Ep 10 Relearning Love: Building Healthy Relationships After Purity Culture with Julia and Jeremiah
episodes.description:
I sat down with Julia Postema and Jeremiah Gibson, both certified sex and relationship therapists, that themselves grew up in high-control religion and purity culture.   Even if you haven’t listened to any purity culture episodes so far, I think this conversation will be incredibly helpful.  We talk broadly about how high-control religion affects our skills for being in healthy relationship.  Julia and Jeremiah pull from their own experiences as well as their work with clients and give helpful tools to begin the hard conversations with anyone you may be in relationship with, especially when there are significant differences to be worked through.

We talk through these questions and many others: What is a healthy relationship?  How do we have a healthy relationship?   How do we start talking about sexuality?  What relationship skills do we miss developing in purity culture?  How do we navigate disagreement?  How do we navigate relationships where each partner is not in the same place in deconstruction?  How is the work for men and women different coming out of purity culture and high control religion?

Link to notes and resources: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1M7h7Z2QQm6WMwdzGA9XZGMqtTHC2ztEfwkwzcxi9uj8/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: To Cult or not to Cult

Judith L Herman, MD

episodes.title: Ilarion Merculieff "Wisdom Keeper" GMT20251016 000223 Rec... | Oct 20, 2025 001
episodes.description:
Ilarion Merculieff joined the CCF team recently for a conversation touching on the history of the Unangan (Aleut) people in Alaska, i'm indigenous view on spirituality and deep knowing and the future of our planet.

Ilarion is the founder of the Global lobal Center for Indigenous Lifeways and Leadership. Visit the the website to learn more about what they are doing to bring Healing and Hope and if you find this talk resonates with you please consider a donation.

https://www.gcill.world/

Please consider viewing the following film to hear a message from the Wisdom Weavers Council.

https://www.gcill.world/videos

episodes.title: Ep 9 PC Men's Experiences with Mike and Mark
episodes.description: Mike Prussack and Mark Simmons joined me for a conversation about their experiences as men growing up in purity culture in the 2x2 church.  Purity Culture seems to have laid the biggest burden on women, but it is not without its effects on men.  I think it’s important to have conversations about how it affected men both to help open conversations around shame and healing but also for those of us in relationship with men to better understand them and start growing healthy relationships together. I’m grateful to Mike and Mark for their courage and vulnerability in sharing their own experiences.  These are not easy topics to navigate.  We do talk about porn, masturbation, and pre-marital sex among other sensitive topics.  Not as experts with any answers, but de-stigmatizing conversations on these topics and the shame that can come with them.  As always, choose to listen or not, pause or come back later if needed.  Listen to yourself and your body and what is right for you.

episodes.title: Personal Story : Jared Snyder
episodes.description:
Jared's Substack (where he posts his podcast) can be found here: https://jared3point0.substack.com/

The episode about Sam is here: https://jared3point0.substack.com/p/son-of-sam
The episode about Leslie White is here: https://jared3point0.substack.com/p/yet-another-leslie-white-story

episodes.title: Ep 8- Reclaiming the Body: Somatic Healing from Purity Culture with Kim Johnson
episodes.description:
I’m excited to share this conversation that I had with Kim Johnson, a somatic practitioner. Kim shares a bit of her own story and experience in high-control religion and purity culture and helps us to re-frame how we see our relationship with our bodies, our emotions, and our authentic selves. She brings an Eastern lens to her work which provides a holistic view of human development and sees our emotions and bodies as important parts of our selves, not separate from our spirituality.  I love that Kim shared so many small, practical things we can do to help ourselves reconnect. She shared several resources and a short embodiment practice at the end of the video.  I appreciated her gentle teaching and I hope you will too.

Link to many resources on healing, how to find Kim, and additional notes: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nD7S2_tfCNS3coxQjFA1w30S11PhOef6zyP_tL_A2so/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: Ep 7 -When Purity Hurts: Trauma, Gender Roles and Women's Stories
episodes.description:
After a break for the summer, Shanna, Amy and Cindy dig deeper into purity culture’s effects on women including physical symptoms that may show up in our bodies, and what we learned about our gender roles and sexuality.  We discuss the shame and guilt that often stays with us even after we leave purity culture.  We also talk about sexual abuse along with some of the trauma it can cause, though not graphically.  If you feel like it’s too much, please listen to your body and stop, take a break or come back later.

Link to Notes, Cindy's convention words and analysis, and Resources: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KxxltQZoqmVUTnEUBMF8Z85K26b30XWKhFYPsJXhzrE/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: Conversation with Dr Janja Lalich, cult researcher
episodes.description:
I was made aware of the work of Dr Janja Lalich through the "Soul Bruises" poscast produced by a friend of mine, Christie Hodson.  Dr Lalich has been studying cults for over 40 years.  While the use of the term "cult" to refer to the 2x2 church is controversial it feels like a conversation that needs to take place.  I recently had to opportunity to have a conversation with Dr Laliach.  We started talking about the struggle a number of us have to reconcile the harm done within the 2x2 church, to ourselves and others, and the positive aspects of it.  We then transition into other areas.  The last two years I have become increasingly aware of the great harm done to many (if not all) of us connected to the church.  This conversation is a direct look at some of that harm and may be quite hurtful to some who still find meaning and value in the church.

Mark Simmons

[While this video is posted on the CCF site the views expressed are solely those of Dr Lalich and myself. This video is not intended to reflect the views of the CCF community and moderators.]

episodes.title: Episode #9 - Is there a "right" way?
episodes.description: In this episode Whitney and Tim tackle the phrase "but it's the closest thing to what we see in the Bible" and discuss if/when form matters, and if form mattered to Jesus.

episodes.title: Healing Spiritual Trauma with Dr. Hillary McBride | A CCF Community Conversation
episodes.description:
Dr. Hillary McBride joins Connected and Concerned Friends (CCF) for a conversation with Shanna Smidt and Teena Daize about spiritual trauma, how it forms, and what healing can look like. Drawing from her book Holy Hurt, she shares insight into fear, shame, grief, and the journey back to self-trust.

The conversation includes a short talk followed by questions collected from our CCF community. Whether you’re still attending or have walked away, this is for anyone navigating the impact of high-control religion.

episodes.title: Message from CSA Survivor Linda Block (Interview with Mark Simmons)
episodes.description:
This conversation was recorded by Mark Simmons, a member of the CCF community, and we’re honoured to host it here with permission. The description below is in Mark’s own words:

“I was recently entrusted with this survivor story. I am humbled by the courage shown by Linda, not only in sharing her story with us now, but by the fact of her continuing to move through a remarkable life the past many years as she carried this incomprehensible burden.”

“Linda has her reasons for sharing this at this point and those are made clear in the watching. I hope that a takeaway for some of you might be the permission to find your own meaning from your experience, as she has.”

We’re grateful to Linda for allowing her story to be shared, and to Mark for creating the space to listen.

episodes.title: Ep 4 Purity Culture in the 2x2 Church
episodes.description:
In this episode of our Purity Culture series, we take a closer look at how purity culture specifically shows up in the 2x2 church. While these teachings are widespread across Christianity, the 2x2 version adds its own unique layers—reinforced by rules, silence, and systems of power.

We explore how purity is tied to control: from rules around sex, modesty, and celibacy to public shaming, rigid gender roles, and strict lifestyle expectations. These messages don’t just shape belief—they impact bodies, relationships, and identity.

This conversation is grounded in lived experience, months of research, and insights from Dr. Tina Schermer Sellers.

Trigger warning: Discussion of sexual abuse, rape, and purity-based shame (non-graphic).

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RLbhO9c99HTlEkLfrcJ2xxElw7HMYMeILR3GnpA_NpY/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: Ep 3 Let’s Talk About Modesty - Introduction To Purity Culture
episodes.description:
Welcome to episode three of the purity culture series. Shanna, Teena and Amy discuss modesty rules in the 2x2 church and ask the question, what does modesty actually mean?

Link to shareable article: 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/19Xow7mtCosiaMyo2sLMxDvIWUJczuLGIrHR2bpJPUA4/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: Ep 2 Purity Culture and the Connection to Rape Culture
episodes.description:
Welcome to our Purity Culture Series
In this series, Teena and Shanna explore the lasting impact of purity culture on our bodies, relationships, and faith communities. Drawing from months of research and with insights from Dr. Tina Schermer Sellers—licensed therapist, sexologist, and leading expert on purity culture—we open up honest conversations to help unpack the messages many of us received.

This week’s episode continues to set the stage for what’s to come. Whether this is a familiar term or brand new to you, we invite you to listen, reflect, and join the conversation.

Trigger warning: sexual assault and rape are mentioned in non-graphic ways. #purityculture

Link to shareable article: 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1i_14i5nEpsR2DsxfkVKz_9WTyZ4bcp0ToR-2Zv5YCoo/edit?usp=sharing

episodes.title: Episode #0: CCF Purpose Statement
episodes.description: In this prequel episode, Tim and Whitney talk about the efforts and considerations of the admin team during the CCF Purpose Statement creation process.  This episode delves into what CCF was, is, and can be; as well as what Tim and Whitney personally believe makes CCF a bridging space for members in and out of the church.
